narration.auto: Welcome to Engineer Cafe, a free public space where engineers can learn, connect, and grow. This deck explains the facility and how to use it.
narration.onEnter: Welcome to Engineer Cafe. This is the first slide of our facility guide.

onDemand.details: Engineer Cafe opened in August 2019 as part of Fukuoka City's "Engineer-Friendly City Fukuoka" initiative.
onDemand.free: The entire facility is free of charge.
onDemand.location: We are located inside the historic Red-Brick Culture Hall, a nationally designated Important Cultural Property.

transitions.next: Let me introduce Engineer Cafe in detail.

narration.auto: Engineer Cafe was created through cooperation between Fukuoka City and its citizens. A community manager and volunteer Hacker Supporters are here daily to help you. The facility is completely free.

onDemand.establishment: Opened in August 2019 under the "Engineer-Friendly City Fukuoka" program.
onDemand.community manager: A dedicated community manager is always on duty to support users.
onDemand.hacker supporters: Volunteer Hacker Supporters answer technical questions and provide advice.
onDemand.free: This is a free public facility operated by Fukuoka City.

transitions.next: Let me explain the available coworking spaces.

narration.auto: Our coworking area includes the Main Hall and four basement spaces. The Main Hall is free when no events are held; details of the basement spaces follow on the next slide.

onDemand.main hall: The open Main Hall is a coworking space that is free whenever not reserved for private events.
onDemand.basement: There are four distinctive spaces in the basement. I will explain them next.
onDemand.events: The Main Hall may have restrictions during events.
onDemand.fee: All spaces are completely free to use.

transitions.next: Let me explain the basement spaces in detail.

narration.auto: The basement offers four unique areas. Meeting Space (2+ people) requires online booking in 2-hour slots. Focus Space has 6 booths—no booking, complete silence. Under Space is free address with extra monitors and one soundproof room. Makers Space provides 3D printers and laser cutters but requires initial training.

onDemand.meeting: For groups of two or more; reserve in advance via website. No same-day booking; 2-hour slots.
onDemand.focus: Six booths, no reservation, talking strictly prohibited—perfect for deep work.
onDemand.under: Free-address seating with extra monitors. Includes one soundproof room (1-hour slots).
onDemand.makers: 3D printers and laser cutters available. First-time users must book a training session online.

transitions.next: Let me explain about time slots and extensions.

narration.auto: Seats are allotted in 2-hour blocks (1-hour for the soundproof room) but you may extend indefinitely if space is available. Request an extension from staff or via the Discord reception channel.

onDemand.basic time: Standard usage time is 2 hours; the soundproof room is limited to 1 hour.
onDemand.extensions: Unlimited extensions when seats are free.
onDemand.how to: Ask staff directly or use the Discord reception channel to extend.
onDemand.discord: The Discord invite code is printed on the back of the neck holder.

narration.auto: The Red-Brick Culture Hall is a national Important Cultural Property. Food is prohibited; only drinks with sealed lids are allowed, and straws are not permitted.

onDemand.cultural property: The building is a nationally designated Important Cultural Property.
onDemand.no food: To protect the property, food is generally not allowed.
onDemand.sealed drinks: Only beverages with sealed lids are permitted.

transitions.next: Let me explain the registration process.

narration.auto: Connect to our guest Wi-Fi, scan the QR code, and complete the registration form. A membership number is issued and cannot be viewed again on your phone—please write it down and tell staff.

onDemand.qr: Scan the QR code at reception to access the registration form.
onDemand.membership: The membership number cannot be viewed later on your phone. Please note it down and inform staff.
onDemand.security: Your data is handled securely and personal information is protected.

narration.auto: Link your membership number to an NFC/IC card such as Suica for tap-in entry. Because the number cannot be re-shown on your phone, we recommend you keep it noted down. Staff can still look it up by your name or email if needed.

onDemand.nfc: You can link Suica or other NFC/IC cards, or a mobile wallet.
onDemand.lost: If you lose your card, staff can retrieve your membership number by your name or email, but having it noted down is safer.
onDemand.strap: Each person receives one neck strap; no replacements available.

transitions.next: Let me explain reception for next visits.

narration.auto: At reception, tell staff which space you wish to use. The neck holder shows Wi-Fi and Discord info. Do NOT leave belongings unattended for over 15 minutes; staff may move them for verification.

onDemand.space: Specify Main Hall, Under Space, or Focus Space at reception.
onDemand.neck holder: Wi-Fi info is printed on the back of the neck holder.
onDemand.away: If you leave for more than 15 minutes, please check out temporarily; unattended items are not allowed.
onDemand.discord: The neck holder also carries our Discord invite code.

narration.auto: This concludes the guide. Opening hours are 9 AM–10 PM. We are in the Red-Brick Culture Hall and completely free to use. Feel free to ask staff any questions!

onDemand.location: Inside Fukuoka City's Red-Brick Culture Hall.
onDemand.free: Use of the facility is completely free.
onDemand.questions: Please ask staff if you have any questions.
